intro: Scurrula chinensis var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan scurrula, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
